meanings.sent1: The baseball hit the window with a loud whamo.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whamo when the door slammed shut.
meanings.sent3: The whamo of the hammer on the nail made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The thunder sounded like a distant whamo in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The whamo of the car crash echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He whamoed the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: She whamoed the door closed in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chef whamoed the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm whamoed the trees, bending them in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The boxer whamoed his opponent with a knockout punch.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express surprise or excitement.
meanings.sent1: Whamo! I can't believe we won the game!
meanings.sent2: Whamo! That was an amazing magic trick!
meanings.sent3: Whamo! The surprise party was a huge success!
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky with a whamo!
meanings.sent5: Whamo! The superhero swooped in to save the day!
